reviews.text:
Ethereal
Don't go on Shabbos, it's closed.
Nice place close to the beach and close to the cable car. Place for pictures and It's free
A small came out of sight with impressive history
Inspiring. A must go when in Haifa
Very historic place and you get a georgios veiw of the Mediterranean sea
It's a nice place for kids but the exhibition is a little bit of old and outdated. The digital exhibition was a lot of fun and 3D movie as well.  You don't need the whole day for this place.

Lots to do. Beautiful grounds and building. We went with 4 and 6 year old boys and the kids were happy spending most of a day there. There is an area with interactive activities and toys for smaller children. The cafe was closed when we went during the week, but there was space to eat. Amazing outdoor Science garden and the Netrix special exhibit was really original and enjoyable, especially the interactive media exhibits that are fun for all ages.

Great place to take the kids to learn stuff and have fun... found two flaws... there is one big exhibit that is outside so not really suitable for rainy days (just this exhibit). And also my kid got lost and there is no way to call him out on the speakers if he is not in the main building
beautiful place. amazing for family and friends.  great  for children
Amazing place for kids. We spent about 5 hours in the museum and could have stayed a lot longer!

A small museum/exhibition gallery of far oriental art. A bit expansive for the size of the collections, but they get an extra star because of the ''extra curricular'' activities, (like lectures and movies) and for a very good coffee place on the 2nd floor (they have fresh pastries and other stuff as well).

All an all well worth a visit!!

An amazing little museum,  so many beautiful plates, dishes, paintings.
Spent an hour being impressed
A nice place to visit, pretty small museum
Museum is a bit old hat but they have good lectures and show good films

My favorite museum in hifa. Small nice and quiet.
Beautiful and inspiring
Nice and small museum of Israeli railway. You can't spend more than 2 hours there, still it's very cute and intimate. Part of the exposition under the roof and part is not (too large trains)
Great place to spend a morning. Not much to see but kids love it. Don't go on a hot and humid day, the place is not air conditioned and part of it is outside with no shade.
Nice for a short visit with kids. Would not go specially for this place, can be "on the way" to other attractions around

Fascinating museum about the history of trains in Israel. Good for kids. My favorite is the elegant railroad car where heads of state traveled. There's also the concrete fortified and armored car used by the British during the Arab revolt of 1936 to 1939. And there's a nice short movie shown in an old passenger coach.
Gwe had a great time, very recommened
